model

Class AnimalNeighborhood

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.AnimalNeighborhood
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<AnimalEntity>

    public class AnimalNeighborhood
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<AnimalEntity>
    A data structure for holding all the animals in hashed buckets so its faster to find neighbors because all animals require a nearest neighbor search for predator/prey interactions. Animals pushed into 10 equally spaced buckets based on their x position.
    Author:
    chris

      • removeAnimal

        public void removeAnimal(AnimalEntity prey)
        This is called throughout iteration of the neighborhood as a result can't remove them while iterating as that will break the iterator, so mark ones for removal and call that at end of step
        Parameters:
        prey -

      • executeRemoveAnimals

        public void executeRemoveAnimals()
        Removes from neighborhood, because neighborhood is updated every turn... the prey should be in the proper bucket, if not search whole grid as fail safe but trigger an error message
        Parameters:
        prey -

      • getNearAnimals

        public java.util.LinkedList<AnimalEntity> getNearAnimals(Vector2D position,
                                                double rangeVector2D)
        I would just like to say I am especially ashamed of this method and its poor coding quality, actually most of this class for that matter, there are so many better and safer ways to carry out these operations
        Parameters:
        position - get nearest animals to this position
        rangeVector2D - NOT ACTUALLY USED, JUST PULLS FROM CENTER AND NEAREST BUCKETS
        Returns:
        list of animals within neighboring buckets
